dataset.title: Bigleaf mahogany (Swietenia macrophylla King) seeds in Taiwan exhibit orthodox storage behaviour

creator.organizationName: Division of Silviculture, Taiwan Forestry Research Institute
Emeritus Research Scientist, Petawawa Research Forest, Natural Resource Canada,
Division of Silviculture, Taiwan Forestry Research Institute

abstract.para: The storage behaviour of Swietenia macrophylla King seeds (Meliaceae) was studied. Seeds that were dried to 3.7% moisture content and stored at 3°C for two years had a 82.7% germination. The two-year stored seeds were then transferred to -196°C and -20°C for continued storage for another one and two years, respectively. Result showed that seeds stored at either -20°C or -196°C retained their original germinability. Thus, seeds of S. macrophylla harvested in Taiwan exhibit orthodox storage behaviour.

intellectualRights.para: If you want to use the information, please contact with me.

section.title: Seed harvesting and handling
section.para: Bigleaf mahogany seeds used in this study were collected from Kaohsiung county,
south-western Taiwan in March 2004. Annual rainfall and annual mean temperature in
the collection site are about 1,952 mm and 25.3°C, respectively (statistical analysis from
2000 to 2008). The brown fruits were air-dried in the sun for about 4 days until they had
opened. Seeds were mechanically and manually extracted. The winged part of the seeds
was removed by hand, followed by fanning to separate wings from seeds. De-winged
seeds were dried in the sun for another 3 days to reduce the moisture content. Each fruit
contained about 60 brown-winged seeds.

section.title: Drying treatment and storage conditions
section.para: The dried seeds were drawn from a bulk collection, which were stored at 3°C in the
Tree Seed Bank of Dongshih Forest District Office, Taiwan Forest Bureau for 2 years.
Moisture contents (fresh weight basis) of the two-year-old seeds were determined by an
oven-dry method with four replications each of intact seeds, corky wings and embryos
separately at 70°C and 80°C for 24 hours, and at 103°C for 17 hours (ISTA, 1999).
Results of the moisture contents analysis are summarized in table 1. The order of seed
moisture contents from high to low in the intact seeds, corky wings, and embryos as
determined by the three different oven-drying temperatures was 103°C > 80°C > 70°C.
Table 1 also shows that corky wings retained a higher moisture content than did embryos.
Seeds typically have higher moisture in embryos than in the seed coat or pericarp. Thus,
the corky wings possessing extensive air spaces may have caused the higher moisture
content.
Prior to transferring the two-year-stored seeds from 3°C to -20°C and -196°C (in
liquid nitrogen) for continued storage, a germination test was conducted with alternating
temperatures of 30/20°C with 12 h of light at the higher temperature for 8 weeks.
Following this reassessment of seed quality, the drawn seed samples were wrapped
in sealed aluminum foil and stored at -20°C for two years and -196°C for one year.
Germination of seeds was based on samples of 75 seeds in three replications of 25 each.

section.title: Seed treatment methods and statstical analysis
section.para: The germination test was carried out by mixing seeds with sphagnum medium (cut into
small piece) at a 75%~80% moisture content in sealable polyethylene bags (0.04 mm
thick) and then incubating them at the alternating temperature of 30/20°C with 12 h of
light at the higher temperature for 8 weeks. The progress of germination was monitored
weekly, and mean percentages of germination were calculated and compared by analysis
of variance (ANOVA) and by the least significant difference (LSD) test at a 5% level
of significance. The mean germination time (MGT) in days was calculated as: MGT =
(Σniti)/N, where ni is the number of seeds germinated in ti days from the beginning of the
test, and N is the total number of germinated seeds at the end of the test. The MGT is a
measure of the rate of germination and of the sharpness of the germination peak.

dataTable.entityName: Table 1. Moisture contents of intact seeds, corky wings and embryos that were dried at different oven temperatures. Samples were stored at 3°C for two years.
